virus.name: Computer Virus
virus.description: Self-replicating malicious code that attaches to legitimate programs and spreads when executed.
virus.attackType: Infects files and programs, causing system damage and data corruption.

phishing.name: Phishing Campaign
phishing.description: Fraudulent attempt to obtain sensitive information by disguising as a trustworthy entity.
phishing.attackType: Social engineering via fake emails, websites, or messages.

ddos.name: DDoS Attack
ddos.description: Distributed Denial of Service attack that floods systems with traffic to exhaust resources.
ddos.attackType: Overwhelms network infrastructure using multiple compromised systems.

ransomware.name: Ransomware
ransomware.description: Malware that encrypts files and demands payment for decryption keys.
ransomware.attackType: Encrypts critical data and demands ransom for recovery.

mitm.name: Man-in-the-Middle Attack
mitm.description: Attacker secretly relays and possibly alters communication between two parties.
mitm.attackType: Intercepts and modifies data in transit between systems.

unauthorized.name: Unauthorized Access
unauthorized.description: Gaining access to systems or data without proper permissions.
unauthorized.attackType: Exploits weak credentials or access controls to gain entry.

insider.name: Insider Threat
insider.description: Malicious activity perpetrated by current or former employees with inside knowledge.
insider.attackType: Abuses legitimate access for data theft or sabotage.

sql.name: SQL Injection
sql.description: Attack that inserts malicious SQL code into database queries via web inputs.
sql.attackType: Manipulates database queries to access, modify, or delete data.

zeroday.name: Zero-Day Exploit
zeroday.description: Attack targeting previously unknown vulnerabilities before patches are available.
zeroday.attackType: Exploits undisclosed vulnerabilities with no existing defenses.

social.name: Social Engineering
social.description: Psychological manipulation to trick people into revealing confidential information.
social.attackType: Uses deception and manipulation through various communication channels.

xss.name: Cross-Site Scripting
xss.description: Injects malicious scripts into trusted websites viewed by other users.
xss.attackType: Executes scripts in users' browsers to steal data or perform actions.

csrf.name: Cross-Site Request Forgery
csrf.description: Forces authenticated users to execute unwanted actions on web applications.
csrf.attackType: Tricks users into submitting requests they didn't intend.

trojan.name: Trojan Horse
trojan.description: Malware disguised as legitimate software to trick users into installation.
trojan.attackType: Provides backdoor access while appearing as normal software.

rootkit.name: Rootkit
rootkit.description: Stealthy malware that provides privileged access while hiding its presence.
rootkit.attackType: Conceals existence and activities from operating system and security tools.

dataexfil.name: Data Exfiltration
dataexfil.description: Unauthorized transfer of data from a computer or network.
dataexfil.attackType: Steals sensitive data through covert channels.

privilegeesc.name: Privilege Escalation
privilegeesc.description: Exploits bugs or design flaws to gain elevated access to resources.

fileinclude.name: File Inclusion Attack
fileinclude.description: Exploits vulnerable include functionality to execute malicious files.
fileinclude.attackType: Includes unauthorized files for execution on the server.

vishing.name: Voice Phishing
vishing.description: Phone-based social engineering to steal personal or financial information.
vishing.attackType: Uses voice calls to manipulate victims into revealing sensitive data.

credentialtheft.name: Credential Theft
credentialtheft.description: Stealing usernames, passwords, or authentication tokens.
credentialtheft.attackType: Captures login credentials through various techniques.

bruteforce.name: Brute Force Attack
bruteforce.description: Systematically checks all possible passwords until the correct one is found.
bruteforce.attackType: Attempts many password combinations to gain unauthorized access.

portscanner.name: Port Scanning
portscanner.description: Probes network ports to find services that might be exploitable.
portscanner.attackType: Maps network services to identify potential vulnerabilities.
